com.scarlatti.attempt2

Class CustomSerializerProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DatabindContext
      • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider
        • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.DefaultSerializerProvider
          • com.scarlatti.attempt2.CustomSerializerProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CustomSerializerProvider
extends com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.DefaultSerializerProvider
    ~ _____ __ ~ (, / | /) /) (__/ ) /) , ~ /---| // _ _ _ _ __ _(/ __ ___ / _ _ __ // _ _/_/_ ~ ) / |(/_(//_)/_)(_(/ ((_(_/ ((_) ) / (_(_(/ ((/_(_((_(__(_ ~ (_/ (_/ ~ Thursday, 11/2/2017

    The serializer provider provides Jackson with serializers (which each have visitable methods) for the object hierarchy.

    DefaultSerializerProvider is abstract!

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        The only time that I want to use a custom serializer right now is for enums.
        Overrides:
        findValueSerializer in class com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider
        Parameters:
        valueType - the visitor is asking for a serializer for this value type
        property - we will ignore for which property the visitor is asking
        Returns:
        the serializer to use (for visitable)
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException - if the mapping fails (it shouldn't!)
